headline: Easy Homemade Pizza Dough
description: An easy pizza crust recipe that will hold all your favorite toppings is simple to make with basic pantry ingredients like yeast, flour, vegetable oil, sugar, and salt.

video.description: This is a great recipe when you don't want to wait for the dough to rise. You just mix it and allow it to rest for 5 minutes and then it's ready to go! It yields a soft, chewy crust.
video.name: How to Make Quick & Easy Pizza Crust

name: Easy Homemade Pizza Dough
recipeIngredient: 1 cup warm water (110 degrees F/45 degrees C)

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C). Lightly grease a pizza pan.
Place warm water in a bowl; add yeast and sugar. Mix and let stand until creamy, about 10 minutes.
Add flour, oil, and salt to the yeast mixture; beat until smooth. You can do this by hand or use a stand mixer fitted with a dough hook to make it easier. Let rest for 5 minutes.
Turn dough out onto a lightly floured surface and pat or roll into a 12-inch circle.
Transfer to the prepared pizza pan.
Spread crust with sauce and toppings of your choice.
Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown, 15 to 20 minutes. Remove from the oven and let cool for 5 minutes before serving.

review.reviewBody: I‚Äôve made homemade pizza dough for years and this recipe was one of the best. We had make your own pizza night with the grands, so I pre bake the pizzas for 5 minutes before they put their toppings on. I will definitely use this recipe when I make pizza again.
Too much water made it taste pasty.
Easy, quick and Tasty!!!

First time I ever made pizza crust, or anything with yeast . Turned out good. I added some italian spices into the dough and pre baked it for 5 mins. The crust is a little thicker than I like, do next time will roll it out thinner. Otherwise it is simple to follow.
So easy to make and so much better than store bought.
Easy and quick. I used the warm feature on my oven 170deg to rise the dough.
I love this recipe! It's so easy to make and comes out great everytime üòÅ.

My dough came out way tougher and drier than it was supposed to. After watching the video I realized the written recipe says 2 1/2c flour whereas the video says 2 1/4c. I‚Äôll try it again with the correct measurements next time. Hopefully this helps someone else.

I love this recipe it‚Äôs honestly so good. I pre bake the crust and then I brush some olive oil, garlic and Italian seasonings onto the crust. I like adding fresh garlic, but pre baking is key so it doesn‚Äôt burn or that your pizza isn‚Äôt undercooked. My favorite is buff chicken!
Super easy!! Tastes amazing! I doubled it and made breadsticks. Brushed garlic butter over the top before baking for 14-17 minutes

Absolutely amazing!! Definitely adding this to my personal cooking book! I used all purpose flour and it was still very nice, crispy and fluffy, just like a restaurant pizza. Just let it rise one hour! Notes: if your crust is too "doughy" between the crust and the toppings, try to pre-bake the crust on its own for 5 minutes at the recommended temp, then pullit oit, add your toppings and bake for an additional 17 minutes! Itll be perfect!
Good quick recipe. Made the dough, let it rise for about an hour (busy doing other stuff) and then I rolled it directly on the greased cookie sheet. Quick and easy pizza fix!
It's a keeper

Followed the recipe exactly. The dough never came together on the dough hook like in the video. Took it out and tried to knead it on the parchment (lightly floured) and it stuck too the parchment. Finally had to re-shape it best I could and put topping on and put in in the oven. It‚Äôs about 3‚Äù thick. Won‚Äôt use this recipe again.

I left the mixer hook on past the dough phase so it turned to a thick batter but after a 10 minute rest it was ready. Some sauce, 2 cups mozzarella & a full layer of pepperoni slices and my wife gave me a two thumbs up. I ate all of my half so it's time to do some walking.

Made it and it came out beautifully! Grated cheese on top and used last nights leftover pork chop (chopped up) and tossed it in half. Will definitely be making it again! Don‚Äôt forget to put on bottom rack if using gas stove in order to get crispy.
We just used the dough to make sausage rolls, and they came out great!

Made this recipe three times and I‚Äôm obsessed with how easy, delicious, and fool proof it is. Use a 12 inch free form pan for a perfect looking pizza, trust me it reminds me of a Pizza Hut pan crust.

I absolutely love this recipe!! I make pizza about once a week now, and this summer my husband bought an outdoor pizza oven - we had a huge pizza and wing fest! I madea bunch of rolls of dough and we let everyone choose their own toppings! It was so fun we're doing it every year now!!

I have been using this for years now, it has never failed. So easy and always excellent! Single. Doubled or tripled it's perfect! We've made dozens of pizzas and calzones and pepperoni breads with this recipe, it's awesome!
Quick, easy and delicious! Homemade pizza start to finish in an hour!
I use this pizza dough when we have pizza my wife like's quite we so do I.
This worked great. I used it for the BBQ Pulled Pork Pizza recipe here on allrecipes.

This has been my go-to recipe for years. Thank you!! I‚Äôve always wondered - in the blog post above, it says rest the dough for 30 min. In the recipe, however, it says rest for 5. Which is best? Also, I usually turn the dough out right into the pan - the first time I tried to roll it out onto the counter, then try to transfer it to a preheated stone was hilllllarious - I topped it before transferring, then had to fold it all up to keep the toppings from spilling everywhere as I tried to move it without burning myself. Then unfold the saucy cheese and misshapen pile‚Ä¶Oh man. No matter how many blogs I read, I still gotta live and learn the hard way sometimes. I also learned I can divide the dough and put it in two pie pans - great for when the littles have friends over and want a personal pizza!
First class recipe! So easy to make and super delicious, it‚Äôs a keeper. Thank you
I love this crust bc it easy to do and it taste great. This will definitely my to go pizza crust

I only had cake flour on me and was really REALLY craving pizza so I decided to give it a go anyways. I halved the recipe and made one decent sized, thick pizza for myself :P It came out soooooo good! I'm only guessing that if I use bread flour in future that it would be 100x better. I'm adding this recipe to my personal recipe book, only the best of the best recipes have the honour of getting saved in my recipe book :D
Good basic recipe. FYI It's 2 1/4 teaspoons of yeast for that .25 packet called for. I think I'll add garlic and honey next time.
I made this one night for dinner, it was so good that the next night when I wanted to make homemade bread I tried it with this recipe. It worked really well! It also makes great rolls!
No, no changes
Very easy recipe to follow the only thing is I used a stand mixer to combine all my ingredients.
Not sure if I kneaded it too much but mine turned out tuff and I could really taste the dough through the other ingredients.

this basic recipe is pretty dang good! I usually do let the dough rise a bit - it doesn't really take long and gives you time to assemble the sauce, toppings, pizza stone, preheat the oven. I would make one big suggestion, and that is to include the weight of the flour. We have been home sick w COVID so have made this twice in the past few days, similar temperature, sam tools, but once with double 00 flour and once part 00 and part unbleached white. I had to add more water in the former, more flour in the latter. And I don't think I am going to get a nice dough with adding more water droplets - hope it gets better as it rises. I appreciate that not everyone has a home scale (although they are inexpensive and GREAT for baking!!), but putting both the cup measurements AND the weight would be really a plus!
This is my go to pizza crust for homemade pizzas. Easy. Tasty and filling! We like it best rolled thin.

This is definitely my go to pizza crust. It is so simple and quick. I usually make homemade pizza at least one night a week. We always vary it up - pepperoni, sausage, ground lamb, buffalo chicken, cheesesteak, taco, the varies are endless. I mix it up, let it sit a few minutes, and press it into my pans, prebake for about 7 minutes, take it out, top it, and bake. Couldn't be simpler or easier. The tough part is deciding what kind of pizza toppings we want. Most times we make 2 different ones. I have made it the way the recipe calls for, but I normally use quick rise yeast, so I can skip the proofing step, just to save a little time.

I‚Äôve made this numerous times- it‚Äôs delish and fast. And faster than I can go pick up one in town. As arid as it is here in NW Montana, I sometimes have to add a touch of water when forming dough.

This will be my go to recipe for pizza dough. I like how the dough doesn‚Äôt need to take hour(s) to rise. I did leave it rest for 25-30 mins, which I feel made it better. My husband likes a flavorful crust & so I added more seasonings to the dough like Italian seasonings & such. Added olive oil on the dough when I had it rolled out- then sprinkled Parmesan cheese around the crust part- Taste wise by adding & tweaking the recipe more, a 9/10! My family said it was the best pizza I‚Äôve made this far. :)
I really like this recipe. It really is quick, easy and tasty.
Deliciousness and simple. Thank you Chef Rider.
Quick and easy as it said

Super easy and delicious. I've made many homemade pizza crust recipes that were more time consuming and required at least 2 rises but this one is super simple with no rise time and its very pliable and easy to work with. Best of all, its very delicious. I'll be throwing away my other recipe cards and using this recipe exclusively.

I made it exactly as instructed and it made a wonderful crust! It was crispy and chewy.. I rolled it out thin and it still held it‚Äôs texture. Perfect crust for a mid week meal with the kids. Especially great when ur pressed with time.
I love this crusti
Just made it ..very easy and I will be making it again

Was super quick and easy to make. Made for a very yummy Sunday lunch. I just topped the pizza with what I had in the freezer (Mince, bacon, cheddar). My daughter devoured it. Now I know how easy it is to make pizza I'm excited to try different toppings.
I made grilled pizza with it and it was fantastic!! Everyone loved it and wanted more.
Very tasty.
Good flavor without being prominent. Prep time very accurate--it's quick! We let it rise some prior to topping and baking so it was thicker. Whole family enjoyed!

This was one of the best homemade pizza dough's that me and my brother had made. It has the best crunch to it but it‚Äôs not to crunchy, almost as if it was soft like a loaf of bread. My dad tried our pizza and he said it was the best pizza he had ever tasted. Thank you for this recipe!!!!!

Great pizza dough recipe. I keep the yeast amount the same, double all other ingredients for a bigger pizza, and let dough sit room temp at least one hour. The dough is airy, and it‚Äôs such an easy recipe. Everyone loves it every time I make it. Such a special meal
Very good and easy to make
Ok, if you don‚Äôt have time to let it rise, but a bit tough.
This was a perfect pizza dough I have been looking for. And I also learned something new by reading the whole article. The only question I have is? How do you turn this in to thick or pan style?
So easy to make and delish!
It‚Äôs good and easy
One of the best pizza crusts ever! Quick and delicious!!!! I will be making the often!

This recipe is true to its word. Easy to make. Tastes great. We have made it straight up, stretched it out for a thin crust, and even done stuffed crust. All turned out perfectly. It's easy to add herbs and granulated garlic to the dough for extra zing, too.
Easily makes 2x excellent 10-12‚Äù pizzas. One 12‚Äù pizza would be almost an inch thick.
This dough comes out great every time bake great and taste wonderful . I have many other dough recipe s but I always come back to this one but this is so fast.
So easy and perfect crust

I have been using this recipe for over a year now. It is the easiest and has great flavor when you decide to make pizza last minute. I put my cast iron pizza pan in the oven and heat to 500 degrees. Use my pizza paddle and semolina flour to slide that pizza on the pizza pan. Ready in 9 minutes, crisp on the bottom and chewy on top. Just the way I like it.
It was good. Will make again.

I always use all purpose as it's what I have and I love this recipe....I've used it right away or let it set and raise for a couple hours as well. Flavor is spot on. Sometimes I add spice to the recipe so the dough has a bite of flavor depending on who is eating it. This is my go to Pizza recipe. Love it!
Family favorite
Easy and awesome!
Delicious and very easy
Good recipe! A few times already. Have used bread (and also Pillsbury Atta) flour as recommended.
Bbq chicken pizza but crust is great!
This is very good, fast and easy. Makes a great pizza crust! .25 ounce package of yeast = 2 1/4 tsp.

This is a great, quick pizza dough. I used a tablespoon each of EVOO and white truffle oil and truffle salt instead of table salt, as well as bread flour. The crust baked beautifully on my pizza stone. There was a lot of dough, so I made half and froze the rest as I make pizza once a week. I use different dough recipes so this one has been added to my list.
did as instructed mmm mmm

Usually, an "instant" dough recipe leaves a yeasty aftertaste, this recipe was spot on! Knowing my oven, I parbaked the dough for 5 minutes, and left the dough out for about an hour. Let gravity stretch this dough :)

I use this crust for all homemade pizza, hotpocket type sandwiches, etc. It's super quick and easy to put together and if you substitute the 2 tbsp for 3 tbsp melted (but cooled/not steaming hot!) It makes a buttery crust great for cheesy garlic fries or breakfast pizza!!

Pro tip this recipe requires 2 1/4 tsp yeast. Using a package measurement without the actual measurement is silly. My yeast comes in 2lbs bags. Let the yeast water, oil, sugar and salt sit in the warm water until a nice frothy head is present. I use a kitechenaid with a dough hook to work the dough. Then put some olive oil on the dough ball. Cold rising for a few days in the fridge is way better as it produces more flavour and better gloutin strands in the dough structure. But in a pinch leave the dough on the counter for 1 hr. until doubled in size then separate into 8oz balls. turning them in on themselves. Let rise again then push the dough out on a floured surface, never roll! I use a pizza stone in my oven and crank it as high as it will go 550F in my case. this allows the pizza to cook quickly forming large cavernouse bubbles. Using parchment under the dough and a peel makes transfer in an off the stone easy.
Quick and delicious üòã definitely time saver for feeding many in a house
Easy as advertised. The second time I made it I embellished a little adding garlic and tabasco to the dough after rising and I put sesame seeds on the crust and it was even better.
Great flavor! We stretched it thin. Baked for 5 minutes at 500 then topped and finished baking at 450. Nice crunch slightly chewy. Will make again:)
Wife and I agreed that this recipe is better than ones out. Definitely cheaper to make
Easy to make, super fast and super tasty. I 'd say -depending on your oven- maybe it needs a lower temp setting (200-210) for 15-20 mins or max temp for 10-12 tops.
Its was amazing
Amazing dough that was super easy to work with and baked very well. Happy mom and family!!!
It is the easiest recipe and ohh so tender! The dough doesn't go hard even the next day! This is my go to from now on!!

We got into making pizza when the pandemic shut everything down. I‚Äôve experimented with lots of different dough recipes. I was skeptical of this one due to the short rise, but this turned out really good. I used King Arthur 00 flour and mixed it in my stand mixer. It was really sticky, so I just kept adding flour until it was the consistency I was looking for. While it was resting, I read the reviews and decided to let it rise for about 30 minutes. I divided it to make two pizzas and cooked it at 550 on my pizza steel. It took about 6 minutes to cook. I have to say this dough was by far the easiest to handle out of all the recipes I have tried. It made pizzas on the thicker side, but the crust was a nice texture. Definitely will be using this one on a regular basis.
It came out really well..!! Thank you

I have been using this recipe for quite awhile now. I have added my own touches to it. For sausage and/or pepperoni pizza, I add garlic, onion powder, basil, oregano and italian seasonings.
While the family loves it their favorite is my BBQ chicken pizza. I substitute the water with chicken broth. Also add garlic and onion powder.
Love the basic recipe. Thank you!!
Wow! I can even make it! Thank you Homemade pizza alot more from now on...

Amazing crust! I've made a lot of pizza crusts these past years... this is by far the best! I love this website. This crust is great! Thick enough to hold sauce and toppings. I made a ricotta pizza - but first baked the sauce, seasonings, garlic, and mushrooms for 15 minutes. Pulled out, then added ricotta cheese, and put it back in the oven at a lower temp for a few minutes, just to warm the cheese. I tried a slice before heating with ricotta, as you'll see in the image. I'll add more sauce next time but there will definitely be a next time! Thanks!
Best Pizza dough recipe I‚Äôve tried so far! My family loved it! I added garlic to the crust for flavor!
This was the perfect recipe! I used regular flour and it turned out great. Awesome!!! Will make it again.

Thank God for a smoke alarm 
450 for twenty minutes. Try ten....
Quick and easy as described!
By far the best recipe I have found on this site; the dough is perfection in the easiest form, and my kids absolutely love it! Incredibly easy to store, too!

LOVE this simple dough recipe. Im a professional baker but pizza crust i don't mess with. This recipe is great and makes it a fun time with my 5 year old son helping. 
 I always add in garlic, Italian seasonings and sometimes a touch of onion powder. 
 I've made this recipe a ton of times and it hasn't failed me yet!

First time ever making pizza crust! Was in a hurry for dinner and it was scheduled to make pizza. Tasted like DiGornio's! I'm proud of myself! I just used all-purpose flour and used instant yeast so i tossed all my dry ingredients first and then added water and olive oil. I added some garlic powder to the mix too since some of the comments said it lacked flavor. I used a pizza stone and didn't have corn flour so i sprinkled just a little of flour on it even though I don't think it needed it. It was perfect! Better than I expected! Will definitely make again!

This recipe is indeed quick and easy. Unfortunately, it is unmanageable as the dough is too sticky. Pizza crust is a type of bread, so you need to be mindful about the amount of water and flour you add. As someone suggested, this recipe is better if 1/2 cup of the water is used for the yeast and the rest is added in small bits about 1/4c at a time or less. Otherwise, the dough will not come together enough and you will need to add a lot more flour until it does not stick so much. Also, if you would like a pizza with a thin crust, you would probably be better using half of the dough. Also, to manage the dough, it also helps to rub a bit of olive oil on the hands. I also did a little bit of kneading but let if rest about 10 minutes or so. It is a good recipe but is not necessarily easy to work with. A rule of thumb is to check the environmental humidity if too high, use less water and if too dry use more but always add gradually.
Very easy and fast
This is a go to crust recipe in our house. I is super easy and so tasty!

I added some
Garlic powder, great easy recipe
Good recipe for a quick pizza crust.
